meeting_annotations.speaker: Kristen Maitland
meeting_annotations.transcript: Okay, so I think we're ready to get started. I'm going to go ahead and call this meeting to order. Welcome everyone to the Research Corporation for Science Advancement Scialog on Chemical Machinery of the Cell. I'm Kristen Maitland, I'm at Texas A&M University, and I'm one of your facilitators for this Scialog. And I'm really excited to be here with you all today. I think we have a really exciting program planned. And I'm really looking forward to the next few days of discussion and collaboration. So with that, I'm going to go ahead and turn it over to Andrew Feig, who's going to give you a little bit of background on RCSA.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Dylan Burnette
meeting_annotations.transcript: I'm Dylan Burnette, I'm at Vanderbilt University. I'm also one of the facilitators for this Scialog. I'm really excited to be here. meeting_annotations.speaker: Andrew Feig
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I'm Andrew Feig, I'm at RCSA, and I'm the program director for the Scialog program. I'm really excited to be here with you all today.
